metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7507 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
GnuTLS version 3.5.12 and earlier is vulnerable to a NULL pointer dereference while decoding a status response TLS extension with valid contents. This could lead to a crash of the GnuTLS server application.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7507` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnutls-bin - 3.5.8-6ubuntu1
libgnutls-dane0 - 3.5.8-6ubuntu1
libgnutls-openssl27 - 3.5.8-6ubuntu1
libgnutls30 - 3.5.8-6ubuntu1
libgnutlsxx28 - 3.5.8-6ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnutls28 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.8-6ubuntu1').
